result.execSummary:
The defendant Dravion M Howell-Bacon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
*The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections as a condition of probation/extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment. Restitution set at ZERO.
*Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
*Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
*Seek and maintain full-time employment OR attend school.
*The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor. The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
*UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF ALL TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION the court will authorize expungement, 973.015.
*AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; cognitive thinking behavior modification.

timeConds.notes: *With work or school release privileges. No good time credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dravion M Howell-Bacon

records.addlTxt: WI Chapter 980 Sexually Violent Person Evaluation Report, received and filed.
UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF ALL TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION the court will authorize expungement, 973.015.

BRANCH 15 FOR BRANCH 38 
Defendant Dravion M Howell-Bacon in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Defendant Dravion M Howell-Bacon in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
As to the charged offense:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 47 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.  Conditions of probation include:
-Serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction with work or school  release privileges.  No good time credit.
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections as a condition of probation/extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.  Restitution set at ZERO.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; cognitive thinking behavipor modification.
-Seek and maintain full-time employment OR attend school
-Parenting classes.
The court orders a 6 month DL revocation.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.     
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF ALL TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION the court will authorize expungement, 973.015.
Filed: CR-233; CR-218; CR-234; Pretrial credit

Attorney James Robert Daniel Rael in court, defendant Dravion M Howell-Bacon not in court, in custody.  
Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Scheduling conference.  Bail motion filed by defense.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Parties advised as of February 1, 2016, this case is assigned to Judge Jeffrey Wagner, Branch 38, Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
DEFENDANT'S NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO MODIFY BOND.

Defendant Dravion M Howell-Bacon in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Defendant Dravion M Howell-Bacon in custody.  Kimberly Schoepp for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Joseph Wong Officer for the Wauwastosa Police Department.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 35.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Dravion M Howell-Bacon in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Dravion M Howell-Bacon in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
